definition: to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to row/to paddle/profitable/worth (the effort)/it pays (to do sth)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)

sentences.english: If your employer isn't already aware of your plans, ask for a meeting to explain.
sentences.chinese: 假如店主还不知道你的谋划，请求劈面解释。

sentences.english: We have new methods likepensation trade and joint ventrue.
sentences.chinese: 我们有赔偿贸易以及合资谋划。

sentences.english: Electronic computers must be programmed before they can work.
sentences.chinese: 必须为电子谋划机编好程序，它才华工作。

sentences.english: The person who planned this crime planned it exactly like a detective-story.
sentences.chinese: 谋划这起罪恶的人完全是在按照侦探小说的模式。

sentences.english: He has no PR people advising him.
sentences.chinese: 他身边没有公关人员替他出谋划策。

sentences.english: Each new day brings another plot to assassinate me and bring us closer to anarchy and terror.
sentences.chinese: 日日有人谋划暗杀我，将国家逼向动乱和恐怖。

sentences.english: Our compa recenty mainly deals with the export business of silk goods.
sentences.chinese: 我公司主要谋划丝织品的入口业务。

sentences.english: The calculated operating tonnage of the die will include stripping pressure.
sentences.chinese: 谋划出的模具工作吨位应包括脱料力。

sentences.english: No employee of the United States Government shall engage in, or conspire to engage in, political assassination.
sentences.chinese: 任何美国政府的雇员不得介入或谋划进行政治暗杀。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the manager is planning a new role for Dalglish under his Anfield reign.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，霍奇森正在为达格利什谋划一个新角色。

sentences.english: Post a topic, and someone will definitely help you out.
sentences.chinese: 发布一个主题，绝对会有人给你出谋划策的。

sentences.english: Friends who have wonderful ideas please don’t be shy and bring forward your suggestions on our group, if you got the talent, don’t waste it.
sentences.chinese: 有好的建议的朋友请在后面跟贴，为团队出谋划策。

sentences.english: That Chu sword achievement the whole political plans all have no from begin to talk almost.
sentences.chinese: 那楚剑功一切政治谋划都无从谈起。

sentences.english: Unlike Best and Gascoigne, he has been shrewdly advised.
sentences.chinese: 不同于贝斯特和加斯科因，他身边一直有人出谋划策。

sentences.english: The banker can engage in two kinds of fraud and embezzlement.
sentences.chinese: 银行家们可以谋划两种方式的欺诈和侵占行为。

sentences.english: The accused was convicted of murder and will be sentenced next week.
sentences.chinese: 被告已被定谋划杀罪并于下周判刑。

definition: to work out a strategy/to come up with a plan for
large scale program of lasting importance/project of paramount importance/to think big/annual national audit
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
